title: Belief systems + web3 (...and magic)
body:
*Context: most weeks, I go to [Gitcoin’s Public Library](https://gitcoin.co/), a nourishing Wednesday chat where a different host proposes an obsession or idea and the group talks it through. This is a write-up of mine — not a formal talk or proposal as such, but a funny fragment of an idea that’s been circulating around my head.*

When I was a kid, I was obsessed with TV magicians.

I grew up in a very small village in the English countryside in the 1980s and I spent a lot of that decade watching cheesy older men in suits perform close-up sleight of hand or the ol’ three ball trick. It didn’t matter that the only people who looked like me on screen were getting sawn in half, wearing feathers and a frozen smile; in a life that’s so far been full of brilliant rabbit holes it’s clear that magic is one of my longest-standing fascinations.

![Paul Daniels; the OG cheesy British magician](https://media.giphy.com/media/QRwGbYHWGwafm/giphy.gif)

*What does this have to do with technology?* I used to ask myself (you’re probably thinking something similar).

Well, let’s start by defining our terms. I’ve always thought of magic in two ways; there’s *performative magic* and *belief magic*.

Performative magic is one of the most honest exchanges between people; whether it’s you and a card shark on the street today, or Houdini escaping from handcuffs in the East River a hundred years ago, in both cases you’re watching artists perform what you both call *tricks*. The magic happens in the ether between the magician or performer and the audience. The audience, whether one person or a hundred, knows they’re being fooled and is delighted by it.

The history of performative magic, and how social changes have impacted it, is fascinating. Such as how the growth of railroads led to the rise of travelling magicians, who often dealt in unorthodox medical cures on the side (cocaine toothache drops, anyone?) or how in the late Victorian era, many historians link the rise of seances to women seeking more economic freedom in the field of spiritualism.

But this piece is about belief magic, which [Merriam-Webster](https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/magic) defines as “the use of means (such as charms or spells) believed to have supernatural power over natural forces” and especially how belief magic is represented in culture. After all, culture, from films to books to art, has always shaped society, just as we shape it. We lack deep decent research on the actual take-up and practice of belief magic and how widespread certain belief systems were, but in a post-graduate degree I did on representations of magic in culture, it was clear magic flourishes in destabilising times. 

Think back to that cheesy older man above in his tux. In the 80s, the UK had a cartoon villain of a leader in Margaret Thatcher; London’s financial centre, the City, grew as our unions weakened; and by the end of the decade, raves were dawning as an expression of anti-establishment fury as the social mobility many families like mine had benefited from was already fading away.

Think Salem in the 1690s, with clashing groups trying to build a world they thought was new. Or, more recently, [covens casting spells](https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/2019/aug/07/monsters-men-magic-trump-awoke-angry-feminist-witches) to prevent Trump’s re-election.

Especially, magic flourished during the British Renaissance. It’s an era I love, with huge leaps forward in invention and knowledge-sharing like the printing press, double-entry accounting and the humble pencil. In a fit of pique, Henry VIII broke with Rome and forged a new religion. New countries and continents were explored and exploited. And England felt under threat at home and abroad, with multiple conflicts with Scotland, France, Spain, and beyond.

Critically, for part of this time, the UK had a female monarch, Queen Elizabeth I, who was both highly educated and visibly unmarried. In the conventions of the era, poets and writers (nearly all men) would write stories celebrating their King for his vigour and intellect. I’m generalising, of course (get in touch with me if you want to nerd out), but women were celebrated for being wives and mothers. As the ruler was seen to subvert nature, as some would have it, we also see an incredible outpouring of the supernatural in the cultural artefacts of the era, from Prospero in *the Tempest*, to *Dr Faustus*, the *Witch of Edmonton*, and many more.

The witches, wizards and magicians in plays and books both thrilled and scared their audiences, and most got their comeuppance by the end of the story.

The monarch who followed Elizabeth I was King James I , who was so obsessed with witches as a source of all evil in the world that he wrote the notorious book [Daemonologie (a study of witchcraft) ](https://www.bl.uk/collection-items/king-james-vi-and-is-demonology-1597) and kickstarted the witch trials that would see thousands of people, nearly all women, tried and executed in the following decades.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vwDFRFz262gIVJ0VASYiJ.png?height=1060&width=1352)

Why have institutions such as the church and the state always been so threatened by magic?

Part of the answer derives from who practices it; again, there are few robust studies of the trials, but less than 15% of those executed were men. Often the women prosecuted were unmarried and intelligent, while lacking the formal education given to their male peers. Often, these women knew herbal remedies to heal ailments or talked back to men in authority.

And magical knowledge tends to be passed from person to person, rather than disseminated top down.

Both then and now, belief magic is ultimately decentralised and community-led (just ask a modern practitioner how they feel about the [Magic Circle](https://themagiccircle.co.uk/)’s elitism). Just like the homemade pamphlets that circulated and enabled citizens to criticise the monarchy or church, their information channels do not rely on conventional means.

*As institutions have tried to exert control over the masses, magic is an attempt — often by marginalised people in society — to subvert that control.*

At its heart, belief magic is a combination of *community knowledge + solidarity networks + folklore.*

By community knowledge, I mean beliefs, truths and cures passed down over time.

By solidarity networks, I mean acting with trust, in small self-selecting groups.

By folklore, I mean the ritualistic repetition of the first to build the second.

You can see the line I’m drawing between the act or art of belief magic and what it means to be working in any emergent technology space; especially this emergent space we call web3, trying to build all three elements at once from the ashes of past scenes that didn’t feel so magical.

Or maybe that’s unfair. Because of when I was born (1980), I grew up both analogue and digital. Even as I began working as a community builder for startups and in big tech, the technology industry developed experiences and conveniences beyond my wildest dreams.

You push a button and a taxi arrives (that may not sound like a wild dream, but you try growing up in a rural area).

You can ask a supercomputer for any obscure topic, and some kind of answer will appear. You open a product and it delights you.

You meet your partner through a funny Twitter account in a way that feels so standard in 2022 but felt intensely magical at the time.

But, over time, these tricks began to feel performative — an act of smoke and mirrors — where the magic disappeared right between the huge corporation telling me it was working in my interest and for the public good, and my actual experience of it.

*What does magic have to do with web3?* you’re probably asking yourself. After all, one has thousands of years of history, and the other’s so incredibly new.

Let’s consider that formula:

*community knowledge + solidarity networks + folklore.*

The web3 communities I’m in have powerful ideologies; these are spaces with shared perspectives and rituals that have emerged over a compressed period of time. This manner of collective world-building in and around projects (in the best possible way, I wouldn’t use the word company) was called *lorecraft* in [this memorable piece](https://studio.ribbonfarm.com/p/lands-of-lorecraft?s=r) by Venkatesh Rao.

For a great example of lorecraft, let’s look at [Crypto Coven](https://www.cryptocoven.xyz/). This high femme female-led NFT collection chose witches as their core avatar due to how much they defy traditional expectations and hold agency and power, and *coven* to emphasise collective creation. But even this short description minimises the craft and care at the heart of this project, both what the original five founders conceived, and how the community around it has taken this world in unexpected and beautiful directions.

Another is Dom Hoffman’s spooky, brilliant [Corruption(s\*)](https://twitter.com/elistonberg/status/1461342536954486787?s=20). After a collection of portal-like NFTs launched without ceremony, a community formed to decipher what they meant both individually and together. Soon, they learnt that if left alone (as in untraded) the insight bar on the bottom right of the image increased over time; if sold or transferred, the insight slows down and changes the look of the NFT itself. Over time, the artist and those interacting with the artwork began sending messages back and forth on-chain.

In both cases, there’s a sense of mystery or necessary key to unlock understanding, powered by secret knowledge that travels back and forth. And, while there was an initial steward or creator, this folklore tends to be decentralised, community-led and learnt from peers.

Beyond that, the community knowledge is also emerging, as the broader web3 community increasingly begins to document what works, even if, like magic, so much of this world can seem impenetrable to those not yet in it (and we need to work harder on magical user experiences).

The very structure of DAOs (decentralised autonomous organisations) themselves provide solidarity networks, with increasing collaboration between DAOs to build a broader scene. It’s early but this blend of *community knowledge + solidarity networks + folklore* exists, right now.

And, for all the criticisms (some fair, some not) I’ve seen levied at this space by non-believers, I’ve seen, with my own eyes, magic being made nearly every day — through refreshed optimism, through hard work done fast, through groups coming together to do what individuals alone cannot.

*At heart, magic embraces the power that small solidarity networks have to change the world through changing their own perceptions of reality.*

This belief is central to Web3 ideology, and we should be heartened by the sheer longevity of magic, despite the best efforts of large institutions, to bring together like-minded people in service of the best possible futures.

*Thanks to Scott Moore and the Gitcoin public library community for giving me the space to explore this, and the [Foster community](https://www.foster.co/) for help editing. Especially, thanks to Stuart Waterman, Heenal Rajani, Ben Percefeld and Maxwell Kantar for comments and suggestions on this in-progress.*

title: Tiny Bytes: Thoughts on Privacy
body:
Hi,

Had a fantastic time chatting with a friend tonight (hi, Ryan, if you’re reading this).

Something that was brought up was privacy in public spaces. Given all the technological advances and our ability to use them to monitor, will public spaces ever have privacy again?

## The Person in the Park

One framing we talked about was it would be like every time you go to the park, there is always someone else there. If a crime happens, someone is watching it. If you fall, someone is watching. If you are smoking, someone is watching. If you want to be alone, someone is watching.

What is interesting about this analogy is “who is the person in the park?” Are they friendly? Are they a snitch? Do they know me? Are they following me?

The technology used and the rules we set around their use will dictate who that person in the park is. The person could just be a friendly stranger. They don’t know who I am and would call an ambulance if I fell down. They could be an obsessive stalker, knowing exactly who I am, tracking what I do, and following me outside the park. Is the person an undercover cop? A salesman?

## Are people allowed to do things without being tracked?

I like the idea of smart cities. I like my cell phone. I like the internet. I like technology. I’m not sure how I feel about everything needing to be tracked.

Tracking data are foundational to many of the advances humans have made. To send a message, we need to track it. To create so many goods, we need to track those goods. To know how well my heart is doing, we need to monitor it. 

(There’s also another topic: generating data isn’t new, just out ability to track it is).

But do we need to track everything?

I’m conflicted. I see that there are benefits. More data means more insights and better decisions. I don’t know if this means better outcomes. We could be measuring poor indicators or interpreting the data wrong. Our flawed understanding of measuring intelligence lead to justifications for eugenics.

There is also something unsettling about everything being tracked. I feel less free to experiment and fail if I know I’m being measured. When learning an instrument or trying to draw, if someone was watching me, I’d feel too insecure and not get into as much.

Does it make a difference if the person watching me isn’t doing anything malicious? I think so. It’s almost impossible to know the person watching me isn’t going to do something that makes me uncomfortable. Maybe they’re watching me draw and say a comment that makes me self-conscious. Perhaps my video recommendations all become about drawing even though I’ve moved on.

I see this fear when I talk to people about privacy. They understand they are being tracked and don’t know what will happen. What is Facebook going to do with my data? I don’t know. Even if the person monitoring me is clear about how data is initially used, I don’t know if it’s not going to be used for another purpose. E.g., a Singapore contract tracing app was initially used just for contract tracing. 1 year later, the police were given access to the location data.

## 

Night,

Lucas

p.s. had some other ideas that I didn’t get to

Can people ever be alone anymore?

    I like alone time but that isn’t always alone. I can be on internet which is tracked.

    People were using other mediums to connect, even while alone (books to connect to other’s thoughts). -- Less tracking involved tho.

To be really, really alone I’m out in the woods. Though it’s a good idea for people to know where you are.

    An idea in here about how people inherently want to be connected.

title: 币圈贡献者： 一群努力且聪明的人
body:
## 一. 前言：

经历过二级市场的血腥风雨，只会开多和开空的我，厌倦了每天穿越牛熊，看着一分钟线，和群友们吹嘘：”牛来了“ ”瀑布了“ 。

粗略统计，一天之内，喊了有50次的牛熊轮回，虽乐此不疲，但看着仓位那点浮动资产， 暗暗决心自己要做出改变，但第二天仍然幻想着一波暴富， 并安慰自己说:”币圈天天都有机会！”

直到三月中旬，一次和群友吹牛过程中，了解到了“空投”的魅力。

在这之前，我从未敢想象到有这么一种独特的商业模式： ”空投“

谈到早期福利： 我不由自主想到 拼多多拉新，砍一刀。 所以对此没有很好的印象。DYDX，ENS空投尝到甜头后，我成了“ 空投信仰者”。 何谈信仰，真金白银赚到手了，变有了信仰。

“ 空投” 是项目方做宣传的筹码， 项目方如同17岁少女，含羞待放。 以空投为饵， 便能吸引到一大批早期追随者，对项目方鞍前马后。 但是太容易得到的用户便不会珍惜，项目方开始拉高门槛，筛选驸马，这很符合时代发展的趋势，空投有限，加深内卷。

但是最终只可能是小白感到云里雾里，而成熟老练的”空投猎人“  把项目方摸的门清。没有大量新人入场，最终结果不言而喻。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/St6WsG8CP3sJHSciFk7sH.png?height=415&width=827)

## 二.正题：

今天谈论的是这么一群人，\*\*Moderator（mod） ， Ambassdor这是一群努力且聪明的人，这在最后我讲细说：

大使是什么？

为什么需要大使？

为什么项目会采用这样的解决方案？

大使需要做些什么？

如何成为大使，这需要什么能力？

## 1.大使是什么？

在实体领域，大使是品牌的代言人，无论是在当地还是在全球范围内。

最理想情况是，大使是他们社区中的内容创作者和积极活跃者，并且应该使用他们的一些资源来推广项目（例如推荐朋友、发布项目信息等）。

此外，品牌代言人（大使）还将代表他们的公司参加某些活动，可以进行线下展示等各种事情。

举例： Pokémon GO 的大使计划：

[https://pokemongolive.com/post/community-ambassador-program](https://pokemongolive.com/post/community-ambassador-program)

## 2.为什么需要大使？

加密货币领域也是如此。

正因为加密货币的项目，大部分是全球性的，一个项目想要获得用户关注，必然需要世界各地的人，尤其是当地的人去推广他们。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/0zwVYIlI3m0oO1HoDU-kq.png?height=1374&width=1726)

## 3.为什么项目采用这种解决方案？

放眼全球，但要立足本地。拥有共同的品牌战略，你需要制定不同的方案，考虑到这个市场的所有不同之处（经济，文化，宗教等等）。因此，在不同的国家，KFC 的菜单各不相同，但贯彻同样的理念—快速又便宜的汉堡。

根据[Nielsen](https://www.nielsen.com/zh/)的数据，与来自品牌的直接信息相比，92% 的市场消费者更可能信任他们本地圈子里的人。据媒体周刊报道，近 75% 的消费者根据社交媒体帖子去决定购买什么，但 96% 讨论品牌的人不关注这些品牌的资料。

在加密货币世界：开发人员必须在一定的时间内完成一个项目，但是要了解每个市场的复杂性（消费者心态、翻译方言等）不是他们所擅长的。 所以看到一些项目团队的职位招聘中。社区经理和营销主管占据了一定比例。

### 大使需要做些什么？

 
 以下是我的一些心得总结：

介绍项目 
 代表项目参加AMA和活动 
 创建AMA和活动来宣传 
 撰写有关品牌的信息 
 举办比赛和营销活动 
 提高社会关注度，用户增长 
 翻译文章、新闻稿等 
 制作信息图表 
 在聊天中交流，帮助社区 
 制作meme梗图 
 制作信息图表分析 （Dune ，Nansen）  
 在discore中 创建一个本地语言聊天频道，用Telegram创建一个本地语言的项目讨论组 
 运营本地语言的Twitter, Instagram, YouTube 等

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9wjk7oafHuYp1-eRiSN_B.png?height=720&width=813)

## 如何成为大使，这需要什么能力？

* 理解技能  是英语知识或通过翻译使用英语的能力（但在这种情况下，您很难通过视频或音频采访）。如果你英语好，在这一块，就已经超过了百分之70的大使了。

\-沟通技巧。和团队成员，社区成员的沟通是重要的，你要能够理解他们的问题的意思（人们通常用蹩脚的英语沟通）并且给予回复。

* 文案 - 撰写和翻译文章。
* 设计- 
* 能够准确，很好地展示项目 - 在 power point、emaze、Google Workspace中工作。

## 作为大使可能会使用到的一些工具汇总：

 [Canva.com](https://www.canva.com/)  Canva可画， 找到合适的模板并开始设计。这是一个老外朋友推荐我的，用海外版本的比较顺手。 免费版本的已经够用了。

我不是设计师，我也不熟悉设计，我只使用一个模板，下载了图片并导入。然后一顿操作。学习了如何使用这个软件（YouTube上视频教程有很多） 做出一些图片对我而言，轻松了许多。 
 

[jitter](https://jitter.video/gallery/)：创建动画文本。像 gif 或短视频之类的东西。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vRk8MMnXl7caZSFogVvEB.png?height=1456&width=1838)

 [Kapwing](https://www.kapwing.com/tools)：为视频添加字幕/音乐/音效。

[Coolbackgrounds](https://coolbackgrounds.io/)：背景数据库

[ColorPick](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/colorpick-eyedropper/ohcpnigalekghcmgcdcenkpelffpdolg?hl=en)：提供颜色代码。  方便颜色的选择。

[Unslash](https://unsplash.com/)：免版税的图片库。

[Adob​​eStock](https://stock.adobe.com/)：优质图片、视频等。有免费内容和付费内容。我中意这个哈哈。

[Emaze](https://www.emaze.com/presentations/)：演示类，创建和分享演示文稿。

格局大一点。除了翻译文章/博客等，有没有其他方法？例如，将你参与项目与它的一些竞争对手进行比较。 
 这需要一些技术门槛，你需要做一些数据分析。

SWOT 分析 ：你值得学习 ： 
 

[https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/swot.asp](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/swot.asp)

**meme图：最好是英文的meme图。方便项目方看到你懂你的意思。**

 
 然后再你自己的语言来做meme图。 使用一些空白/模板，以免你在新项目的meme上花费大量时间。虽然meme图很不错，但是竞争非常激烈。很内卷，不一定管用。 
 

再Discord 的聊天中保持活跃。持续去舔。我在以前，认为这样不对，更加注重有价值的内容，因为我想“如果我制作很好的内容，为什么还要浪费时间聊天？”

但是后来我发现我错了， 只有更加活跃，也就是去主动舔项目，才能获得更多的关注度，提名或者是当选mod/ambassdor ，现实就是如此。

 
 **留下深刻印象:** 
  
     AMA 提出一个很好的问题。如何去做？你需要提前翻译内容，而不仅是 ctrl + c、ctrl + v，或者是聊一些最新的新闻和更新。您可以在聊天中与管理员聊天，但不要总是@他们，只需在对话中恰当的切入进去便可。 
  
     社区治理，mod和大使，更多的是偏向于“人治”  道德是唯一的底线（如果你有的话）。所以很难有效的阻止作恶。 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VC1v057Whfw8Oo_yQ1tbh.png?height=520&width=802)

    **国际化的弊端**有一点就是： 团队成员无法熟知每一地区的人在做什么？ 所以他们需要一个社区领导来代替他们进行传话。 这便会导致垄断话语权，你想和项目团队直接沟通，你的建议和意见往往会得到消极的回复，或者是让你联系你本地的领导人进行对话。

 
  
    所以这里面有着很大的操作空间，熟人内推和mod出卖集体利益（721 club 社区mod卖白）等等作恶行为，导致这行业变得混乱和复杂。 

   早期介入一个项目会使你获得极大的优势，一个项目可能只会选一到两名本地语言mod，更多的并不是关注你有很多的能力和很高的水平。

 
 可能只需要你去主动提出担任职位，并且积极聊天，使用机器翻译公告，便能获得mod等等。 很多是作为志愿者的身份去做一个mod，并且承诺在融资/发币之后，给予一部分利益，因为这部分没有太多人去分蛋糕（项目团队成员），报酬丰厚， 所以大家**趋之若鹜。**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pwXtDiQxIDQHSFt_YZs4-.png?height=1110&width=810)

Pliz，不要当乞丐“： 
  
 你需要杜绝这样的想法：并不是你做了什么，就能应得什么。 很多贡献者得不到他们应有的报酬。

## 个人能力提高：

[digitalgarage](https://learndigital.withgoogle.com/digitalgarage/courses) 免费的在线课程，谷歌也颁发自己的证书。证书是引用的，也就是说，可以将其添加到简历中。

[Open Learn Uni：](https://www.open.edu/openlearn/free-courses/full-catalogue)英语大学的开放式学习环境。我推荐这个。也可以进行SWOT 分析。课程结束后可获得证书。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Gw9rxKfLQ8aKBc5eKeV1K.png?height=1610&width=2706)

[Visme：](https://visme.co/courses/presentations/exam/)关于使用 visme 的免费课程。他们颁发证书也可以添加到简历中，、

免费英语课程<https://www.udemy.com/course/jumpeng_basics/>

Udemy 免费课程<https://www.udemy.com/courses/free/>

免费课程<https://www.coursera.org/courses?query=free>

title: Which Liquid Staking Derivative should I use?
body:
In this article, I will be covering Liquid Staking Derivatives, which are tokens that provide you with yield on ETH, derived from ETH staking rewards. Please feel free to skip forward to the various sections if you’re already familiar with the mentioned topics.

# TLDR;

* Decentralized + non-custodial pool = 100% transparency for user deposits
* More node operators in pool = more diverse = less chance of getting slashed
* Rocket Pool = most decentralized *and* diverse liquid staking protocol
* rETH is the only LSD with deep insurance (>200%) for slashing protection
* Yield is hardly ever free - even in the most risk/trust minimized pools, you may still face software bugs or smart contract risks.

# What is Ethereum Staking?

Many familiar with ‘staking’ - where you deposit tokens somewhere, and you gain a reward for locking your token up. But why are they paying you? It is important to understand where the yield is coming from. 

Some apps pay you to lock up your tokens as that reduces selling pressure (eg. ‘stake’ $CAKE for more $CAKE). In proof-of-stake networks, validators provide a stake of tokens as collateral while providing a service to the network. They are paid when they do their job well, and penalized when they don’t. Other networks allow you to delegate and entrust your tokens to a node operator to earn yield.

In [Ethereum proof-of-stake](https://ethereum.org/en/staking/), staking has the following properties:

* Validators can be created per 32 ETH
* They are paid ETH rewards for proposing correct blocks, and validating others’ blocks
* They can be penalized (slashed) if they attempt to be malicious
* Designed to encourage a diverse set of stakers
  * The goal is to reduce centralization risks
  * Low hardware requirements (it can run off a Raspberry Pi)
  * Low penalty for being offline => If you are down for a day, you only need to stay online for another day to break-even on the penalty
  * Penalty grows with # of impacted validators - discourages people from running too many validators with the same configuration/client software

Even with the [low barriers to entry](https://thedailygwei.substack.com/p/staking-at-home-the-daily-gwei-515) on the infrastructure end, some users are still excluded because of various reasons:

1. They don’t have 32 ether
2. They don’t want to run a machine for various reasons
3. They don’t want to lock up capital or wait for withdrawals / exit queue in order to access their capital
   1. It is impossible to withdraw staked ETH from the Ethereum protocol as of writing. It is estimated that this will only be enabled 6 months after the Merge (transition to proof-of-stake).

The demand for this is *huge* - [Cardano, for example, has over 70% of its supply delegated](https://www.newsbtc.com/news/cardano/staked-cardano-reaches-high/) because barriers to extra yield are low. As of writing, only about 11.5% (14m out of 120m) of ETH are staked.

# What are Liquid Staking Derivatives (LSDs)?

Enter LSDs. To simulate the ‘delegated’ proof-of-stake user experience, numerous entities have risen up to the occasion. You give them ether, they stake it on your behalf, charge a commission on the rewards, and give you an IOU token (the LSD). Centralised Exchanges do it (Kraken with ETH2.0, Binance with BETH), staking pools do it. You don’t even need 32 ETH to start. Users are spared from running a validator, and have *some* access to capital. Pool operators make money, everyone’s happy. 

Most LSDs are also ERC20 tokens which are accepted for use in DeFi. For example, Lido’s stETH is accepted as collateral in Maker, Aave, and Alchemix. Rocket Pool’s rETH proposal for Maker and Aave are in flight and should be implemented shortly, and it is already live on Alchemix. This offers users more flexibility and capital efficiency.

# What are my options, which should I use?

A breakdown of risks are shown on [ethereum.org/staking/pools](https://ethereum.org/en/staking/pools/). 

![Overview of staking pools](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/dGaRrZrXIMq37MtPPxw0b.png?height=2308&width=2156)

I could go on all day about how Pool A or Pool B is too big, concentrates too much power, and is bad for the Ethereum ecosystem in general. But today I’ll like to focus on a few factors that I think deserve more attention:

### Non-Custodial / Trustless 

With the fall of even trusted names (Mt Gox, Celsius, 3AC) in previous years and 2022, it is getting harder to be convinced that a single company / entity will full control of your funds will act in good faith over an extended period of time. Opt for trustless and transparent pools.

### Decentralization / Node Operator Count

Node operator represents the person/entity who is operating a validating node. A single node operator can run almost any number of validators on that node. Validators running on the same node are exposed to similar hardware/client bug/configuration risks.

Node operator count as of writing (July 2022), in the 2 biggest pools:

Lido: 21

Rocket Pool: 1331

### Slashing / Downside protection

Rocket Pool is the only pool that allows permissionless node operators. This means that it also requires node operators to put up collateral in order to stake on the users’ behalf. A side effect of that is that rETH is the LSD with the most slashing protection. This makes rETH particularly suitable for DAOs/Treasuries where downside to the principle is an absolute no-no.

![Illustration of backing behind 16 ETH](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/FEutFgIq32ehb7as1i0mb.png?height=922&width=1380)

# Conclusion

* Decentralized + non-custodial pool = 100% transparency for user deposits
* More node operators in pool = more diverse = less chance of getting slashed
* Rocket Pool = most decentralized *and* diverse liquid staking protocol
* rETH is the only LSD with deep insurance (>200%) for slashing protection
* Yield is hardly ever free - even in the most risk/trust minimized pools, you may still face software bugs or smart contract risks.

### Disclosure

I own some rETH and RPL.

title: KNN3 x Next.ID Partnership — An Identity Focused Case Study
body:
# What is KNN3?

If Web3 and blockchain technology have a common criticism, it is that data is extremely hard to make sense of. It sometimes feels as though developers speak a completely different language as they discuss their findings on Etherscan or any other block explorer, and this is a major cause of friction for newcomers into the Web3 space.

After all, the quicker Web3 grows, the greater the need for avenues of understanding the data that comes out of it.

Enter KNN3. KNN3 is a direct result of this environment, providing simple-to-understand explanations of on-chain relationships in graphic/pictorial form. Although it is primarily a backend protocol, KNN3’s existence enables and facilitates generations of developers to build on an easy-to-translate interface, effectively lowering the barrier of entry to build consumer-facing dApps.

Ultimately, KNN3 aims to be completely community-driven, in order to unlock greater applications of on-chain data collaboration.

# How KNN3 works with Next.ID: A case study

KNN3 is a social graph protocol. This means that as users generate footprints on blockchains, KNN3 aggregates these to interpret the connections among users, converting them into relational connectors. All 100% verifiable on-chain.

Next.ID, on the other hand, is a Decentralized-Identity-as-a-Service (DIaaS) protocol that aggregates digital identities across Web2 and Web3, allowing users to create permissionless DID (decentralized identifiers) called Avatars.

With the permissionless integration of Next.ID and the introduction of Next.ID’s Avatars, KNN3’s graphs are given brand new life:

* there is now an **identity-first** component to the data
* Avatars provide off-chain identity data for more **comprehensive** profiles

## Identity-first data

KNN3 aggregates data in a neutral manner, allowing for the eventual empowerment of social dApps and AI analytics. Next.ID provides a subjective perspective of the data, with a focus on streamlining identity.

This allows for work done with KNN3 to take on a completely new dimension, using the synergy between KNN3 and Next.ID to create new forms of social graphs and networks.

## Comprehensive data across Web2 and Web3

As KNN3 is focused on aggregating blockchain data, Next.ID covers one blindspot by providing access to Web2 data as well. If users’ Avatars are connected to their Web2 accounts like Twitter and Discord, KNN3 will now have access to these connections, allowing it a much more comprehensive view of the social graph.

Based on the Avatars’ associations of users’ Web2 (Twitter) and Web3 (blockchain wallets) accounts on Next.ID, KNN3 can now provide users with social graphs mapped across Web2 and Web3. With these graphs, developers and users will have a more streamlined experience of Web3, as well as access to previously-unheard of usage scenarios like social relationship discovery/recommendation and a robust reputation system.

title: Own up if you f*ck up
body:
Maybe you stumbled upon this while still actively considering to break the “big news” to your answerable party.  

Easier said than done, looks better on paper than in person, but here’s some brownie points for owning up if you’re wrong, from a leader’s perspective.

## You Take Everyone Into Consideration

Especially if you are in a position of authority, you already know what your mates are going to have to go through to blind rush a project. 

Lack of sleep, absolutely hating what you used to love, refilling your 5th cup of coffee, being irritable at your partner, doubting your work quality. 

Being among [the 73% of millenials](https://www.forbes.com/sites/sarahlandrum/2016/10/05/3-times-when-millennials-should-say-no-at-work/?sh=2f2524091e85) who find it hard to say “no”, more often that not we depend on figures of authority to promote the right culture. 

## Deadlines Are More Considerate Than You Think 

Assuming you already have the desirable traits of finishing your project under normal circumstances, things just *happen* in life. 

You lose a loved one, your car broke down, your cat went into labour, in most cases clients are more than willing to accept a deadline extension on compassionate grounds.

This is why pay-to-complete-fast should be discouraged if the minus of the equation is having someone unwillingly stay up at odd hours. They didn’t sign up for that.

## Your Quality Of Work Is Questionable

Time is no state of matter, but one thing they do have in common is that you simply cannot squeeze a few week’s worth of work into 3 days. 

Just like a fruit when you cut corners, there’s only so much inefficiencies you discover before you start cutting the product itself. 

You will start feeding your starving to do list with half baked work, in the same way a person who couldn’t care less about his job would. 

## The Balance Of Being Humble Yet Responsible

I get it, this is not ideal for everyone if your project is a life or death situation. Surgeon, if you’re reading this please do get back to your operation and consider to have others on shift to step in next time. 

Nor is something serious enough to own up, if its a university paper you have no interest about I’d give it a pass.

title: Own up if you f*ck up
body:
Maybe you stumbled upon this while still actively considering to break the “big news” to your answerable party.  

Easier said than done, looks better on paper than in person, but here’s some brownie points for owning up if you’re wrong, from a leader’s perspective.

## You Take Everyone Into Consideration

Especially if you are in a position of authority, you already know what your mates are going to have to go through to blind rush a project. 

Lack of sleep, absolutely hating what you used to love, refilling your 5th cup of coffee, being irritable at your partner, doubting your work quality.

title: 币圈mod的大使计划——一群勤奋且聪明的人
body:
## 一. 前言：

经历过二级市场的血腥风雨，只会开多和开空的我，厌倦了每天穿越牛熊，看着一分钟线，和群友们吹嘘：”牛来了“ ”瀑布了“ 。

粗略统计，一天之内，喊了有50次的牛熊轮回，虽乐此不疲，但看着仓位那点浮动资产， 暗暗决心自己要做出改变，但第二天仍然幻想着一波暴富， 并安慰自己说:”币圈天天都有机会！”

直到三月中旬，一次和群友吹牛过程中，了解到了“空投”的魅力。

在这之前，我从未敢想象到有这么一种独特的商业模式： ”空投“

谈到早期福利： 我不由自主想到 拼多多拉新，砍一刀。 所以对此没有很好的印象。DYDX，ENS空投尝到甜头后，我成了“ 空投信仰者”。 何谈信仰，真金白银赚到手了，变有了信仰。

“ 空投” 是项目方做宣传的筹码， 项目方如同17岁少女，含羞待放。 以空投为饵， 便能吸引到一大批早期追随者，对项目方鞍前马后。 但是太容易得到的用户便不会珍惜，项目方开始拉高门槛，筛选驸马，这很符合时代发展的趋势，空投有限，加深内卷。

但是最终只可能是小白感到云里雾里，而成熟老练的”空投猎人“  把项目方摸的门清。没有大量新人入场，最终结果不言而喻。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/St6WsG8CP3sJHSciFk7sH.png?height=415&width=827)

## 二.正题：

今天谈论的是这么一群人，\*\*Moderator（mod） ， Ambassdor这是一群努力且聪明的人，这在最后我讲细说：

大使是什么？

为什么需要大使？

为什么项目会采用这样的解决方案？

大使需要做些什么？

如何成为大使，这需要什么能力？

## 1.大使是什么？

在实体领域，大使是品牌的代言人，无论是在当地还是在全球范围内。

最理想情况是，大使是他们社区中的内容创作者和积极活跃者，并且应该使用他们的一些资源来推广项目（例如推荐朋友、发布项目信息等）。

此外，品牌代言人（大使）还将代表他们的公司参加某些活动，可以进行线下展示等各种事情。

举例： Pokémon GO 的大使计划：

[https://pokemongolive.com/post/community-ambassador-program](https://pokemongolive.com/post/community-ambassador-program)

## 2.为什么需要大使？

加密货币领域也是如此。

正因为加密货币的项目，大部分是全球性的，一个项目想要获得用户关注，必然需要世界各地的人，尤其是当地的人去推广他们。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/0zwVYIlI3m0oO1HoDU-kq.png?height=1374&width=1726)

## 3.为什么项目采用这种解决方案？

放眼全球，但要立足本地。拥有共同的品牌战略，你需要制定不同的方案，考虑到这个市场的所有不同之处（经济，文化，宗教等等）。因此，在不同的国家，KFC 的菜单各不相同，但贯彻同样的理念—快速又便宜的汉堡。

根据[Nielsen](https://www.nielsen.com/zh/)的数据，与来自品牌的直接信息相比，92% 的市场消费者更可能信任他们本地圈子里的人。据媒体周刊报道，近 75% 的消费者根据社交媒体帖子去决定购买什么，但 96% 讨论品牌的人不关注这些品牌的资料。

在加密货币世界：开发人员必须在一定的时间内完成一个项目，但是要了解每个市场的复杂性（消费者心态、翻译方言等）不是他们所擅长的。 所以看到一些项目团队的职位招聘中。社区经理和营销主管占据了一定比例。

### 大使需要做些什么？

 
 以下是我的一些心得总结：

介绍项目 
 代表项目参加AMA和活动 
 创建AMA和活动来宣传 
 撰写有关品牌的信息 
 举办比赛和营销活动 
 提高社会关注度，用户增长 
 翻译文章、新闻稿等 
 制作信息图表 
 在聊天中交流，帮助社区 
 制作meme梗图 
 制作信息图表分析 （Dune ，Nansen）  
 在discore中 创建一个本地语言聊天频道，用Telegram创建一个本地语言的项目讨论组 
 运营本地语言的Twitter, Instagram, YouTube 等

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9wjk7oafHuYp1-eRiSN_B.png?height=720&width=813)

## 如何成为大使，这需要什么能力？

* 理解技能  是英语知识或通过翻译使用英语的能力（但在这种情况下，您很难通过视频或音频采访）。如果你英语好，在这一块，就已经超过了百分之70的大使了。

\-沟通技巧。和团队成员，社区成员的沟通是重要的，你要能够理解他们的问题的意思（人们通常用蹩脚的英语沟通）并且给予回复。

* 文案 - 撰写和翻译文章。
* 设计- 
* 能够准确，很好地展示项目 - 在 power point、emaze、Google Workspace中工作。

## 作为大使可能会使用到的一些工具汇总：

 [Canva.com](https://www.canva.com/)  Canva可画， 找到合适的模板并开始设计。这是一个老外朋友推荐我的，用海外版本的比较顺手。 免费版本的已经够用了。

我不是设计师，我也不熟悉设计，我只使用一个模板，下载了图片并导入。然后一顿操作。学习了如何使用这个软件（YouTube上视频教程有很多） 做出一些图片对我而言，轻松了许多。 
 

[jitter](https://jitter.video/gallery/)：创建动画文本。像 gif 或短视频之类的东西。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vRk8MMnXl7caZSFogVvEB.png?height=1456&width=1838)

 [Kapwing](https://www.kapwing.com/tools)：为视频添加字幕/音乐/音效。

[Coolbackgrounds](https://coolbackgrounds.io/)：背景数据库

[ColorPick](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/colorpick-eyedropper/ohcpnigalekghcmgcdcenkpelffpdolg?hl=en)：提供颜色代码。  方便颜色的选择。

[Unslash](https://unsplash.com/)：免版税的图片库。

[Adob​​eStock](https://stock.adobe.com/)：优质图片、视频等。有免费内容和付费内容。我中意这个哈哈。

[Emaze](https://www.emaze.com/presentations/)：演示类，创建和分享演示文稿。

格局大一点。除了翻译文章/博客等，有没有其他方法？例如，将你参与项目与它的一些竞争对手进行比较。 
 这需要一些技术门槛，你需要做一些数据分析。

SWOT 分析 ：你值得学习 ： 
 

[https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/swot.asp](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/swot.asp)

**meme图：最好是英文的meme图。方便项目方看到你懂你的意思。**

 
 然后再你自己的语言来做meme图。 使用一些空白/模板，以免你在新项目的meme上花费大量时间。虽然meme图很不错，但是竞争非常激烈。很内卷，不一定管用。 
 

再Discord 的聊天中保持活跃。持续去舔。我在以前，认为这样不对，更加注重有价值的内容，因为我想“如果我制作很好的内容，为什么还要浪费时间聊天？”

但是后来我发现我错了， 只有更加活跃，也就是去主动舔项目，才能获得更多的关注度，提名或者是当选mod/ambassdor ，现实就是如此。

 
 **留下深刻印象:** 
  
     AMA 提出一个很好的问题。如何去做？你需要提前翻译内容，而不仅是 ctrl + c、ctrl + v，或者是聊一些最新的新闻和更新。您可以在聊天中与管理员聊天，但不要总是@他们，只需在对话中恰当的切入进去便可。 
  
     社区治理，mod和大使，更多的是偏向于“人治”  道德是唯一的底线（如果你有的话）。所以很难有效的阻止作恶。 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VC1v057Whfw8Oo_yQ1tbh.png?height=520&width=802)

    **国际化的弊端**有一点就是： 团队成员无法熟知每一地区的人在做什么？ 所以他们需要一个社区领导来代替他们进行传话。 这便会导致垄断话语权，你想和项目团队直接沟通，你的建议和意见往往会得到消极的回复，或者是让你联系你本地的领导人进行对话。

 
  
    所以这里面有着很大的操作空间，熟人内推和mod出卖集体利益（721 club 社区mod卖白）等等作恶行为，导致这行业变得混乱和复杂。 

   早期介入一个项目会使你获得极大的优势，一个项目可能只会选一到两名本地语言mod，更多的并不是关注你有很多的能力和很高的水平。

 
 可能只需要你去主动提出担任职位，并且积极聊天，使用机器翻译公告，便能获得mod等等。 很多是作为志愿者的身份去做一个mod，并且承诺在融资/发币之后，给予一部分利益，因为这部分没有太多人去分蛋糕（项目团队成员），报酬丰厚， 所以大家**趋之若鹜。**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pwXtDiQxIDQHSFt_YZs4-.png?height=1110&width=810)

Pliz，不要当乞丐“： 
  
 你需要杜绝这样的想法：并不是你做了什么，就能应得什么。 很多贡献者得不到他们应有的报酬。

## 个人能力提高：

[digitalgarage](https://learndigital.withgoogle.com/digitalgarage/courses) 免费的在线课程，谷歌也颁发自己的证书。证书是引用的，也就是说，可以将其添加到简历中。

[Open Learn Uni：](https://www.open.edu/openlearn/free-courses/full-catalogue)英语大学的开放式学习环境。我推荐这个。也可以进行SWOT 分析。课程结束后可获得证书。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Gw9rxKfLQ8aKBc5eKeV1K.png?height=1610&width=2706)

[Visme：](https://visme.co/courses/presentations/exam/)关于使用 visme 的免费课程。他们颁发证书也可以添加到简历中，、

免费英语课程<https://www.udemy.com/course/jumpeng_basics/>

Udemy 免费课程<https://www.udemy.com/courses/free/>

title: The Twitter Blue subscription is getting more expensive
body:
People frequently express their amazement that Twitter is free, but for some people, it isn’t — Twitter Blue [launched last year in several countries](https://www.theverge.com/2021/6/3/22464291/twitter-blue-subscription-service-canada-australia-undo-reader-mode), tacking on a few extra features for anyone willing to pay $2.99 per month. Today the service told subscribers it’s increasing the price (via [Matt Navara](https://twitter.com/MattNavarra/status/1552808984389849088)), and in the US, [it’s jumping up to $4.99 per month](https://help.twitter.com/en/using-twitter/twitter-blue-help#price-increase). That probably won’t break the pockets of information addicts who are choosing to pay for a service that still includes advertisements in their feed, but it might be enough to make people ask themselves if it’s worthwhile.

The add-ons in the Twitter Blue package range from extremely useful (an undo tweet window to fix typos, a customizable navigation bar, a list of Top Articles shared by people you follow, and [ad-free access to articles](https://www.theverge.com/2020/1/28/21111865/scroll-ad-free-website-subscription-launches) on sites including *The Verge*) to trivial (the ability to choose from different app icons) to questionable ([NFT hexagon profile pics](https://www.theverge.com/2022/1/20/22893502/nft-twitter-profile-picture-crypto-wallet-opensea-coinbase-right-click)).

RELATED

#### Twitter shouldn’t be hiding basic app improvements behind its Blue paywall

In an email to users, the Twitter Blue team insists the higher rate “helps us continue to build some of the features you’ve been asking for, improve upon the current ones you already love and sustain our mission of supporting journalism.”

title: Motherland
body:
So many of us grow up as “others”. Questioning where we fit in, who our tribe is and how our identity meets the world. For me, this was the story of much of my life as a Japanese-New Zealander who was never Japanese enough to be Japanese, or white enough to be white. My teenage love of jazz, hip hop and drum’n’bass all stemmed from the same needs - these were music forms where I could find comfort and community through diving into albums created from artists’ own searches for belonging and identity: sonic offerings that decried the status quo and mainstream seeking something more. This premise has been my foundation as an artist - creating music that looks to answer my own inner questions and reflect the world I see, while knowing that emulating the status quo does little to help me understand my own past, present and future.

**Motherland** is a 43-minute film, a meditative audio-visual exploration of my Japanese ancestry and culture. Presented as both a **super-NFT film** and **audio NFTs**, Motherland features my Japanese roots-inspired music through a solo performance, set to footage shot during an artist residency in Kaga, Japan, during Summer 2019. It’s a series of instrumental tone-poems and immersive audio-visual moments to let your imagination play.

The collector of the super-NFT Motherland film will also receive **additional content** and a **share in the entire collection’s revenue** (more about that below). As well as sharing the project to share my art, I’m excited to experiment with different ways to present, share and incentivize music in the web3 space.

***\* Due to file size, please allow up to two minutes for the film to buffer before it plays - alternately you can view it on [YouTube](http://youtu.be/3Ingh1qZmU8)***

[auction://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7?tokenId=3750](auction://0xabEFBc9fD2F806065b4f3C237d4b59D9A97Bcac7?tokenId=3750)

## The Film

We begin **Motherland** on the train ride to Kaga, and then on to an immersive journey of soundtracked sights following outdoor pathways to temples, rivers and lakes, accompanied by the sounds of nature and the eight compositions.

The footage of Japan featured in the film was shot in two locations - **Kakusenkei Gorge**, a beautiful forested valley with a river running between, and **Natadera Temple** - a Buddhist temple established in 714 AD with sprawling grounds, temple buildings and a distinct feeling of spiritual homeland. Along with the visuals, I’ve incorporated all the field-sound - the summer breeze rustling the trees, cicada song in the air, and the river’s running water. These create an integral connecting of the music with the visuals, and underpin the film with the sonic signature of nature.

Each composition included in the film is introduced with *shodo* (traditional Japanese calligraphy) by visual artist **Kuniharu Yoshida**. The visual of the shodo and sight of Kuniharu’s hand in motion captures so much of the spirit of ancestry and roots which this project focuses on, and I’m grateful to have his contributions here.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/AoIkXLj3xAHG5cTHi10qm.jpg?height=1348&width=2396)

## The Music

**Motherland** features eight instrumental compositions. Each piece has its own story - shared in storytime twitter threads:

1. Motherland \[[storytime](https://twitter.com/MdCL/status/1412113085381287942)\]
2. Kodama Shade \[[storytime](https://twitter.com/MdCL/status/1411787529674629122)\]
3. Mizugaki \[[storytime](https://twitter.com/MdCL/status/1411425225950912513)\]
4. Akatombo (trad.) \[[storytime](https://twitter.com/MdCL/status/1411031495381188610)\]
5. Bushidō \[[storytime](https://twitter.com/MdCL/status/1410291753421131777)\]
6. O-Edo Nihonbashi (trad.) \[[storytime](https://twitter.com/MdCL/status/1409929297725300737)\]
7. Natadera Spirit Walk \[[storytime](https://twitter.com/MdCL/status/1409598984826486787)\]
8. The Offering \[[storytime](https://twitter.com/MdCL/status/1409274446754377736)\]

My performance was filmed in Los Angeles, utilizing my Ableton rig that, as well as emulating my first love - the piano, allows me to live-sample, play synths, program rhythms and essentially gives me a palette to paint whatever sounds I imagine. Where some of my work dives heavily into beat-culture and the dancefloor, Motherland is an introspective offering, leaning primarily on the sound of the piano and subtle use of electronics to tell the story.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vYH2K0udctxqI46gcBVIG.jpg?height=1324&width=2552)

## The NFT Collection

Motherland is a deeply personal project for me and it’s important to present it in a way that preserves this meaning. Shout-out to my friend [Sirsu](https://twitter.com/sirsuhayb) who helped me put this collection together and encouraged and supported me to enter the NFT space.

The collection consists of:

* the super-NFT film
* [eight 1-of-1 individual-track audio NFTs](https://beta.catalog.works/spaces/4d1264a1-f68c-44ee-96cb-1a3f3479c637)
* [50 open-edition digital mixtape NFTs](https://rarible.com/token/0xd07dc4262bcdbf85190c01c996b4c06a461d2430:623387)
* four (only 4!) hand-pressed, translucent vinyl commemorative pressings. No more vinyl will be pressed.

The winning collector of the **Motherland Film** **Super-NFT** will receive:

* **the full-res film** digital file (non-commercial use only)
* **individual WAV files** for all eight audio pieces (non-commercial use only)
* edition #1 of the **hand-pressed translucent vinyl**
* **share of all sales** of the audio NFTs consisting of: 5% royalty share on all eight 1-of-1 single-audio NFTs + 2% royalty share on the open edition Motherland digital mixtape NFTs. The assigned share from primary sales is held in wallet [0xbd5E9c1C43Ded1E9656e24281Ad378F9Ab364A64](https://etherscan.io/address/0xbd5E9c1C43Ded1E9656e24281Ad378F9Ab364A64), for transfer to the winning collector. 

Every bidder on the **Motherland** **Film Super-NFT** will also go in a draw to win edition #2 of the hand-pressed translucent vinyl (to be drawn following a successful auction).

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/w-kQfpxZKMfuUf2ADWTDs.jpg?height=1080&width=1080)

## The 1-of-1 Audio NFTs

Each of the film’s eight pieces of music has been minted as a 1-of-1 audio NFT. [Auctions hosted on Catalog](https://beta.catalog.works/spaces/4d1264a1-f68c-44ee-96cb-1a3f3479c637).

Every bidder on any of the audio NFTs will also go in a draw to win edition #3 of the hand-pressed translucent vinyl (to be drawn when all eight 1-of-1 audio NFT auctions close or one year after initial minting, whichever is sooner).

5% of all sales of these NFTs will be credited to the collector of the film super-NFT. [Auction reserve set to 0.5 ETH each](https://beta.catalog.works/spaces/4d1264a1-f68c-44ee-96cb-1a3f3479c637).

title: Swapchat x Next.ID — Unlock Chats On OpenSea + Twitter For NFT Negotiations
body:
# Swapchat x Next.ID: The first Web3 chat tool that works on OpenSea

Trading on OpenSea is pretty much a straightforward affair. Open a tab, browse the collections you want, find sellers with art that speaks to you, place a bid, and *voila*, you may be the owner of a super-rare punk.

What if this experience could be improved? [Swapchat](https://www.web3messaging.online/)’s new partnership with Next.ID solves exactly this.

# What are Swapchat and Next.ID?

**Swapchat** is a decentralised cross-platform messaging app that aims to increase communication across Web3 communities, reducing the crypto community’s reliance on centralised platforms like Twitter and Discord and addressing the lack of interactive functions on Opensea. Users can send direct messages as well as form community group chats around NFT collections using Swapchat’s Chrome plugin.

Complementing Swapchat is **Next.ID**, a Universal Identity System. Next.ID is a protocol that enables users to crystallize and solidify their online identities across Web2 and Web3, consolidating and authenticating identities from social media platforms (eg Facebook and Instagram) to blockchain wallets (eg Metamask). Next.ID builds the basis for a comprehensive user-owned digital identity social graph, enabling us to grow our networks beyond isolated accounts.

# OpenSea 🤝 Swapchat 🤝Next.ID 🤝 Twitter

When you see what Swapchat has built on OpenSea, your first thought will be “OpenSea should have built this long ago!” By allowing conversations between buyers and sellers, a natural conclusion will be a greater price discovery mechanism via negotiations. Buyers will be able to offer NFTs, tokens, and any combination of both for sellers to consider, and sellers will have a different avenue to better articulate price demands.

Because Swapchat works cross-platform, users can easily get notifications for updates on Opensea from their Twitter interface and vice versa. Plus, if users can also use Swapchat as an initial starting point before moving to trusted third party protocols like [Sudoswap ](https://sudoswap.xyz/)for OTC NFT transfers — without extra fees.

# How Swapchat x Next.ID can revolutionize Web3 communities

Next.ID’s universal identity system opens new pathways to building a community. For example, users who connect their Twitters to Metamask via Next.ID are able to follow each other and continue their conversations there.

Buyers and sellers of gaming NFTs can discuss strategies and potential combinations that will give them an edge over others, and GameFi projects benefit from greater liquidity and communication among players.

Newly-launched projects can also encourage greater conversations within their communities in a trustless way, using Swapchat as a tool to drive hype and conversations about roadmaps.

title: DID Summer #1: Being Human in Web3 || Twitter Spaces Recap
body:
# DID Summer Episode 1: Being Human in Web3

Next.ID hosted DID Summer Episode 1 on 20 July 2022 with Decentralised Digital Identity (DID) Web3 builders — KNN3, Collab.land, Ceramic, .bit and Unipass. Representing various types of DIDs with different use cases, they set aside some time to discuss the importance and use cases of DIDs.

They shared diverse perspectives on DIDs, such as how ownership of identities can enable greater use cases. Use cases include proving one’s humanity beyond wallet addresses and this could even bring about real-world use cases beyond Web3. These builders also shared their project’s roadmaps and their thoughts on DID’s future outlook.

You can watch the full episode on YouTube: <https://youtu.be/tE1cw6HXJTQ>

# Key Takeaways:

* In current identity systems, we, as users, do not own our identity. However, this has enabled third parties like Web2 social media companies to remove our content and even our accounts.
* Decentralized Digital Identities (DIDs) are important as they give us ownership over our identities and thus our voice in the world. Ownership enables us to:

1. Own and claim credentials
2. Build our financial and social reputation
3. Build our relationships and connections with others
4. Blend our IRL and digital identities

* DIDs are bringing ownership of individual identities via private wallets and NFTs. More forms of identification may be expected to emerge as projects find more ways to decide what constitutes the user’s DID.
* DIDs enable us to identify ourselves beyond our wallet addresses, proving our identities in more holistic and colourful manners. This includes:

1. Aggregation of our Web2 & Web3 identities
2. Contextualisation of our social connections with others
3. Verifiable credentials that build our social and financial reputation

* DIDs prove our individuality — DIDs use proofs such as verifiable credentials to validate identities. Using DID protocols, we are able to validate IDs, eliminate bots and enable different types of governance.
* As we build the identity infrastructure for dApps, we can expect future use cases such as:

1. Alternative governance and voting models
2. Integration of SBTs and DIDs to create a trustless mechanism in Web3 social
3. Greater coordination of Web3 social activities

For anyone who is interested in future Twitter Spaces, please follow Next.ID @nextdotid. We will be hosting more events of this kind, and continue to invite more industry leaders and emerging Web3 builders to talk with us.

Speaker Info:

* Yisi Liu, Core Maintainer of the [Next.ID](http://next.id/) Community
* Thomas Yu, Co-founder of KNN3
* James Young, CEO of Collab.Land
* Lauren Feld, Head of Growth at Ceramic
* Vicky, Director of Global Market at .bit
* Iris, Head of Business Development and Strategy at Unipass
* Host: Hannah Shen, Head of Global Growth at Next.ID

Project Info:

* [KNN3](https://www.knn3.xyz/) is a Web3 relationship aggregator on multiple blockchains
* [Collab.land](https://collab.land/) leverages the power of identity through cryptocurrency to create a social space unique to a specific network of humans.
* [Ceramic](https://ceramic.network/) is a decentralized data network that brings unlimited data composability to Web3 applications.
* [.bit](https://www.did.id/) are Web 3.0 identities for you and your community
* [Unipass](https://www.unipass.id/) is a universal passport to the metaverse
* [Next.ID](https://next.id/) is the world’s first Decentralized-Identity-as-a-Service (DIaaS) protocol

DID Summer is a Twitter Space series by Next.ID where Web3 projects and builders gather and exchange ideas on building cutting-edge decentralized identity infrastructure and applications.

title: How should we think about inflation
body:
Today I want to share inflation and interest rates.

As everyone knows, inflation is very high now. June inflation was 9.1 percent, up from 8.6 percent in May and at a four-decade high.

The main reason for high inflation is that the USA adopted the "American Rescue Plan" during the COVID-19 pandemic. It included an increase in the federal minimum wage, direct checks for Americans making $75,000 or less a year, an extension of $400 federal unemployment benefits, and more money for small businesses. The total pandemic-relief tab to several trillion dollars.

The American Rescue Plan Act of 2021 has contributed to inflation. So the Federal Reserve announced several interest rate increases in 2022 as it races to tamp down rapid inflation.

The impact of the interest rate hike on the global financial market is unavoidable. The global financial market has declined in the past six months, including the stock and crypto markets.

But recently, we have seen the dollar index rise, and the euro has tumbled to parity against the US dollar. It’s the first time the euro has sunk to that level since 2002, in the early years of the currency’s existence.

Many people think that the Fed's money printing is an act of drinking poison to quench thirst. The temporary prosperity was followed by record-high inflation. But I think the Fed is waging a currency war. At present, not only the USA, most European countries and developing countries are facing unprecedented high inflation rates. The USA is shifting its government debt through a rise in the dollar index, making global residents pay for the American Rescue Plan.

As a practitioner in the crypto industry, we should always pay attention to the Fed’s policy. The crypto market is currently closely linked to the global financial market. While the market conditions have not been optimistic these months, once Fed slows the pace of interest-rate increases, I think everything will get better. Considering that Fed’s aggressive rate hikes raise the likelihood of a recession, the Fed is likely to signal a more dovish stance.

body:
*撰写：NFT God*

*编译：TechFlow intern*

12 条 NFT 投资原则将使你成为更好的 NFT 交易员：

**1.在你按下购买键之前，问问自己为什么觉得**这个项目在\*\* **6** \*\***个月后会更有价值**。如果你不能回答这个问题，或者答案是 "我只是希望它涨得更高"，那么你可能不应该买入。**只要你不进场就永远不会赔钱。**

**2.从每次失败中学习**。做一个交易笔记本，写下每一笔交易以及你为什么要进行交易，事后对交易进行反思。永远不要犯同样的错误两次。

**3.你不需要通过交易来参与市场**。保持不离场的方法：跟踪热门趋势、参与 Twitter/Discord、加入 Twitter Space、撰写有价值的内容......

**4.总是保留着一些 ETH**。你永远不知道什么时候会有一个新的机会，我喜欢将我的 ETH 分成两半，一半拿着，另一半投资加密货币/ NFT。永远不要梭哈。

**5.及时获利了结**。但事实是，在 NFT 中获利是非常困难的，当你有机会获利时，不要贪心，及时获利。

**6.清理你的推特信息**。找到合适的社区/圈子，过滤市场的噪音。

**7.如果你感到你的情绪波动很大，请关闭你的电脑**。情绪会影响你的判断力，NFT 交易特别容易受情绪影响。再次强调，如果你不进行交易，你永远不可能输钱。只在你的最佳状态下进行交易。

**8.不要在你醒来后或睡前的最后半小时看**\*\* \*\***NFT**。这是一个让你在上床睡觉或开始一天的工作时处于不良心态的坏方法，NFT 的价格是非常不稳定和情绪化的，心理健康是有效交易的关键。

**9.永远不要因为有人说什么，你就买什么**。你不知道他们的策略是什么，也不知道他们什么时候卖，我从来没有通过抄袭别人的交易获得过一次盈利，独立思考，DYOR。

**10.如果该项目已经上涨了，那么你就太晚了**。NFT 通常会上涨然后回撤，如果你在上涨时买入，你可能会成为回调的一部分。等待一个低成交量的环境来购买。

**11.不要让 NFT 成为你投资组合的主体** 。一个平衡的投资组合是非常关键的，如果你的投资组合中 NFT 太多，无论你的资产处于什么价格，都要出售。现金流和股票也是投资组合中非常重要的一部分。

**12.不要跟着 KOL 进行交易**。这个领域金钱腐蚀了一切，你以为他是大 V，但更有可能是一把“镰刀”。

title: 黑豹社区-撸毛入门级教程
body:
## 认知篇-什么是撸毛

**1.1** **测试网交互**

项目方上线之前，通常会先推出测试网来进行前期测试，这就需要咱们这些测试用户的帮助了。通常我们能根据指示领到测试网的代币进行内测，系统会以咱们钱包的地址为交易线索，并记录咱们的交易数据以及运行数据。项目方根据数据再找出运行中的不足以及漏洞，并对项目加以改进与完善，以确保项目在主网上线时能顺利运行。  
 在整个过程中我们会帮助项目方进行测试并且为他们提供数据，为了感谢早期内测的用户，通常会以空投的形式给内测用户分发一部分代币。（测试网空投）零撸的一种

**1.2  主网交互**

主网交互空投是项目方对早期用户的奖赏，因为是这些早期用户成就了项目，贡献了流动性、贡献了数据、贡献了反馈，所以项目方往往会把1-10%不等的代币份额直接空投给普通交互用户，空投价值通常在几十美元到几万美元不等。按照平均空投数量的最高可卖出价计算，最近一年多已经有UNI、1INCH、TORN、DYDX、RBN、INV、FLX等至少7个价值过万美元的空投，价值过千美元的项目则至少有30个，过百美元的则以百数记。需要支出gas费，小额资金适合，回报大，注意反撸风险。

**1.3 表单空投**

通过填写表单:twitter账号,Discord账号等，来提交完成任务,或推荐邀请好友，

**1.4   抽奖空投**

通过twitter转发，点赞，关注 加入某项目方Discord方举办的空投活动来获得空投，建议多号。

**1.5  打新IDO，肝白名单**

通过追踪关注最新项目方发布的消息来确认发布的代币或者NFT白名单，利用信息差和早期用户的身份，实现低买高卖，赚取利益。

**小结**：很多人认为撸毛就是去找几个项目，注册一下做个任务就完事儿了，但实际上并没有那么简单，撸毛是存在门槛的。 没有专业的团队持续关注更新，很多做过的项目都会随着时间过去不了了之。白白浪费了时间很精力，币圈让大家离金融更近了一步。在这里你可以通过信息差📝赚钱、本金💰投资赚钱、时间⌚️赚钱。撸毛就是一种通过时间⌚️成本去换取收益的方式。要注意不被反撸，现在很多项目为了用户量会用空投的幌子来做营销，例如之前的很高调的Beta Finance，有人花了几千美金的Gas费去交互多个账号，结果损失惨重，所以一般来说事先明确声明空投的项目不用在意，还有很多项目会以完成一系列社交任务为要求进行空投，或者根据推荐用户数量发奖励，虽然不需要啥实际成本，但比较耗费时间精力，也不太值得参与，项目几乎一个月十来个真正的优质项目需要从他的投资背景，可信度，和知名度，还有能力来决定撸不撸，不然花费了宝贵的时间还没有收益，这是我们撸毛人最不愿看到的。

## 工具篇-撸毛的必备5个工具包含教程

* **申明：撸毛需要使用电脑，VPN，浏览器可选择**[Google](https://www.google.com/intl/zh-CN/chrome/),   [火狐](http://www.firefox.com.cn/)    ,[Microsoft edge](https://microsoftedgewelcome.microsoft.com/zh-cn/get-started?int=00&exp=e999&focus=performance&form=MA13DW)

**2.1 VPN**

VPN是我们用来科学上网的必备软件，每次撸毛前需要开启VPN，保护我们的IP隐私，并实现更换IP为VPN上提供的IP地址，可以自由浏览使用外网软件。

[https://bixiny.com/index.php#/register?code=jPxU7UoL](https://bixiny.com/index.php#/register?code=jPxU7UoL)

**2.2 元掩码**

去中心化钱包，撸毛必备软件，需要保管好助记词和私钥。

撸毛三件套之一，用于加入频道验证身份，参加空投活动。[Discord登录下载地址](https://discord.com/)

[https://jiemahao.com/blog/discord-course/](https://jiemahao.com/blog/discord-course/)

总结：这些是撸毛入门最基本的一些知识，后期会更新更多的空投教程。希望你们可以通过撸毛实现财富自由 ，可以通过币圈走上人生巅峰，迎娶白富美，自由自在地享受人生。

title: KNN3 x Next.ID Partnership — An Identity Focused Case Study
body:
# What is KNN3?

If Web3 and blockchain technology have a common criticism, it is that data is extremely hard to make sense of. It sometimes feels as though developers speak a completely different language as they discuss their findings on Etherscan or any other block explorer, and this is a major cause of friction for newcomers into the Web3 space.

After all, the quicker Web3 grows, the greater the need for avenues of understanding the data that comes out of it.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/pW8Nh04eTqSCvqPMY7cTT.png?height=630&width=1200)

Enter KNN3. KNN3 is a direct result of this environment, providing simple-to-understand explanations of on-chain relationships in graphic/pictorial form. Although it is primarily a backend protocol, KNN3’s existence enables and facilitates generations of developers to build on an easy-to-translate interface, effectively lowering the barrier of entry to build consumer-facing dApps.

Ultimately, KNN3 aims to be completely community-driven, in order to unlock greater applications of on-chain data collaboration.

# How KNN3 works with Next.ID: A case study

KNN3 is a social graph protocol. This means that as users generate footprints on blockchains, KNN3 aggregates these to interpret the connections among users, converting them into relational connectors. All 100% verifiable on-chain.

Next.ID, on the other hand, is a Decentralized-Identity-as-a-Service (DIaaS) protocol that aggregates digital identities across Web2 and Web3, allowing users to create permissionless DID (decentralized identifiers) called Avatars.

With the permissionless integration of Next.ID and the introduction of Next.ID’s Avatars, KNN3’s graphs are given brand new life:

* there is now an **identity-first** component to the data
* Avatars provide off-chain identity data for more **comprehensive** profiles

## Identity-first data

KNN3 aggregates data in a neutral manner, allowing for the eventual empowerment of social dApps and AI analytics. Next.ID provides a subjective perspective of the data, with a focus on streamlining identity.

This allows for work done with KNN3 to take on a completely new dimension, using the synergy between KNN3 and Next.ID to create new forms of social graphs and networks.

## Comprehensive data across Web2 and Web3

As KNN3 is focused on aggregating blockchain data, Next.ID covers one blindspot by providing access to Web2 data as well. If users’ Avatars are connected to their Web2 accounts like Twitter and Discord, KNN3 will now have access to these connections, allowing it a much more comprehensive view of the social graph.

Based on the Avatars’ associations of users’ Web2 (Twitter) and Web3 (blockchain wallets) accounts on Next.ID, KNN3 can now provide users with social graphs mapped across Web2 and Web3. With these graphs, developers and users will have a more streamlined experience of Web3, as well as access to previously-unheard of usage scenarios like social relationship discovery/recommendation and a robust reputation system.

title: Adidas vs Nike: The NFT Proxy Wars.
body:
Who doesn’t love a good rivalry? McDonald’s & Burger King, Coke & Pepsi, British Airways & Virgin Atlantic, Barcelona & Real Madrid facing off in *El Clasico*, Manchester United & Liverpool’s fiery clashes, and Australia & England competing for the Ashes may spring to mind. Alternatively, DC Comics and Marvel Comics have been locked in an 80+ year battle to control the comics space.

And then you have Adidas & Nike. Two juggernauts who for nearly 6 decades influenced sportswear and shaped the cultural landscape and now jostle for domination over a market worth upwards of $300 billion.

The battle between the *swoosh* vs the *three stripes* evolved over the decades, whether it was through design, ads, or sponsorships. Recently that battle has spilled over into a new arena with Adidas and Nike both entering the Web3 space in December 2021, and there’s no sign of the rivalry slowing down.

[https://twitter.com/RTFKT/status/1470502806868140037](https://twitter.com/RTFKT/status/1470502806868140037)

In this latest chapter of the battle for dominance, the two sportswear giants have taken different approaches. In September 2021, Adidas’ got their hands on Bored Ape Yacht Club (BAYC) NFT #8774, a smart move considering BAYC’s collection is arguably the most well-known both inside and outside the NFT space. They didn’t stop there, they used their ownership rights to create the character Indigo Herz which led to a a formal partnership with BAYC, Punk Comics and Gmoney. To truly cement themselves as serious players, Adidas purchased land in the Sandbox to create AdiVerse - a virtual playground which owners of BAYC, Punk Comics and Gmoney NFTs can access for virtual, unique collectables from Adidas.

![Indigo Herz, image courtesy of Adidas](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Cgzt4kfv5CVGHp3BrjkgB.jpeg?height=1279&width=1432)

Your move Nike.

As a precursor to their Web3 foray, Nike launched Nikeland, a metaverse built inside Roblox. Users in the game could style their avatars with Nike gear and unlock sport related superpowers to name a few perks. All of which proved popular amongst the game’s player base.

Nike made a major splash in December 2021 when Nike acquired RTFKT Studios. Who are RTFKT Studios? Only the leading creators of virtual sneakers in the Web3 space and the co-creators of one of the most popular NFT collections to date. After starting out creating digital apparel, RTFKT’s decision to expand beyond into avatars with their Clone X project has firmly established a digital ecosystem consisting of digital wearables and avatars which can be used across any metaverse. In what could turn out to be a genius move, Nike have inserted themselves at the forefront of the digital space, holding a great deal of power and influence. With the constraints of the physical world stripped away, Nike through RTFKT are bound only by their imagination and what they can dream up.

![Clone X avatar, image courtesy of RTFKT](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/alX-_SA4MqQqt8YpmQqgL.png?height=1600&width=1600)

What does the future hold?

Both brands will surely have exciting projects up their sleeves. The RTFKT x Nike AR Genesis Hoodie for example will bridge the gap between the digital and physical realm by releasing as a wearable for your RTFKT Clone avatar as well as your IRL self. Augmented reality experiences merging with fashion is a exciting intersection that Nike is well placed to command. One thing is for sure, Adidas and Nike will continue to do battle with their Web3 ventures.

![RTFKT x Nike AR Genesis Hoodie, image courtesy of RTFKT](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/S-fJgTyVyUtsdzUzEOdvM.jpg?height=1080&width=1080)

With such big players as Adidas and Nike, the door is certainly open for more entities from the apparel and fashion world to enter the Web3 space. Or maybe we’ll see rivalries from other industries spill over into Web3 - Mcdonalds or Burger King NFTs anyone?

title: Volume-Weighted Average Price (VWAP)
body:
## What Is the Volume-Weighted Average Price (VWAP)?

The volume-weighted average price (VWAP) is a technical analysis indicator used on intraday charts that resets at the start of every new trading session.

It's a trading [benchmark](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/b/benchmark.asp) that represents the average price a security has traded at throughout the day, based on both [volume](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/v/volume.asp) and price.

VWAP is important because it provides traders with pricing insight into both the trend and value of a security.

### KEY TAKEAWAYS

* The volume-weighted average price (VWAP) appears as a single line on intraday charts.
* It looks similar to a moving average line, but smoother.
* VWAP represents a view of price action throughout a single day's trading session.
* Retail and professional traders may use the VWAP to help them determine intraday price trends.
* VWAP typically is most useful to short-term traders.

## Understanding the Volume-Weighted Average Price

VWAP is calculated by totaling the dollars traded for every transaction (price multiplied by the volume) and then dividing by the total shares traded.

VWAP = Cumulative Typical Price x Volume/Cumulative Volume

Where Typical Price = High price + Low price + Closing Price/3

Cumulative = total since the trading session opened. 
 

### How to calculate VWAP

By adding the VWAP indicator to a streaming chart, the calculation will be made automatically. However, to calculate the VWAP yourself, follow the steps below.

Assume a 5-minute chart. The calculation is the same regardless of what intraday time frame is used.

1. Find the average price the stock traded at over the first 5-minute period of the day. To do this, add the [high, low, and close, then divide by three](https://www.investopedia.com/articles/trading/11/trading-with-vwap-mvwap.asp). Multiply this by the volume for that period. Record the result in a spreadsheet, under column PV.
2. Divide PV by the volume for that period. This will produce the VWAP.
3. To maintain the VWAP throughout the day, continue to add the PV value from each period to the prior values. Divide this total by total volume up to that point.

To make Step 3 easier in a spreadsheet, create columns for cumulative PV and cumulative volume and apply the formula to them.

TradingView.

## How Is VWAP Used?

VWAP is used in different ways by traders. Traders may use VWAP as a trend confirmation tool and build trading rules around it. For instance, they may consider stocks with prices below VWAP as undervalued and those with prices above it, overvalued. If prices below VWAP move above it, traders may [go long](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/l/long.asp) the stock. If prices above VWAP move below it, they may sell their positions or initiate [short positions](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/short.asp).

Institutional buyers including [mutual funds](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/m/mutualfund.asp) use VWAP to help move into or out of stocks with as small of a market impact as possible. Therefore, when they can, institutions will try to buy below the VWAP, or sell above it. This way their actions push the price back toward the average, instead of away from it. 
 

VWAP's incorporation of volume is valuable to traders for what it can indicate about the degree of trading activity during short periods of time—whether the competition is taking or exiting positions.

## Special Considerations

### The Difference Between VWAP and a Simple Moving Average

On a chart, VWAP and a [simple moving average](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/sma.asp) (SMA) may look similar. However, these two indicators are calculated differently and represent different results.

VWAP is calculated by multiplying typical price by volume, and the dividing by total volume.

A simple moving average incorporates price but not volume. The SMA is calculated by totaling [closing prices](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/c/closingprice.asp) over a certain period (say 10 days) and then dividing the total by the number of periods (10).

### Limitations of VWAP

VWAP is a single-day indicator and restarts at the open of each new trading day. Attempting to create an average VWAP over many days could distort it and result in an incorrect indicator.

While some institutions may prefer to buy when the price of a security is below the VWAP, or sell when it is above, VWAP is not the only factor to consider. In strong uptrends, the price may continue to move higher for many days without dropping below the VWAP at all or only occasionally. Therefore, waiting for the price to fall below VWAP could mean a missed opportunity if prices are rising quickly.

VWAP is based on historical values and does not inherently have predictive qualities or calculations. VWAP is anchored to the opening price range of the day. Therefore, the indicator increases its lag as the day goes on.

This can be seen in the way a 1-minute period VWAP calculation after 330 minutes (the length of a typical trading session) will often resemble a 390-minute moving average at the end of the trading day.

## What Is the Volume-Weighted Average Price (VWAP)?

The volume-weighted average price (VWAP) is a measurement that shows the average price of a security, adjusted for its volume. It is calculated during a specific trading session by taking the total dollar value of trading in the security and dividing it by the volume of trades. The formula for calculating VWAP is cumulative typical price x volume divided by cumulative volume. 
 

## Why Is the Volume-Weighted Average Price Important?

VWAP gives traders a smoothed-out indication of a security’s price (adjusted for volume) over time. It is used by institutional traders to ensure that their trades do not move the price of the security they are trying to buy or sell too extremely.

For example, a hedge fund might refrain from submitting a buy order for a price above the security’s VWAP, in order to avoid artificially inflating the price of that security. Likewise, it might avoid submitting orders too far below the VWAP, so that the price is not dragged down by its sale.

## What Is the Difference Between the Volume-Weighted Average Price and a Simple Moving Average (SMA)?

Like the VWAP, the [simple moving average](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/sma.asp) provides traders with a less volatile view of the recent price trend of a security. Unlike the VWAP, however, the simple moving average does not take into account the level of volume in that security’s trading.

VWAP weights each day’s price change by the amount of volume occurring in that day, whereas the simple moving average incorporates price and no volume.
